Column Comment.0: LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this facility license.
Column Comment.1: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventually becomea SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.2: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.3: VIOLATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a violation of a license agreement.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: LICENSE CONDITION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the condition that is appliedto this license. Populate only if you need a direct relationship to the condition thatwas violated.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: RESOLVED DATE: The date that this violation was resolved by submitting requiredinformation, paying fines, amending procedures etc.
Column Comment.11: RESOLVE DESCRIPTION: A short narrative description of the resolution of theviolation, such as procedures modified, report submitted, fine paid.
Column Comment.12: LICENSE VIOLATION RESOLUTION TYPE: The type of resolution to a violation of alicense term, such as the payment of a fine or creation of new processes.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: VIOLATION DATE: The date on which the violation was first on record, such as thedate that the regulatory agency notified you about a problem, or the date whensomething such as a report was overdue.
Column Comment.15: VIOLATION DESCRIPTION: a narrative description of the license violation that hasbeen recorded.
Column Comment.16: VIOLATION TYPE: The type of violation of a license that is being recorded. Can beas simple as failure to submit necessary reports or something more difficult such asimproper procedures.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
